channel.title: uberon: Definition changes
channel.description: RSS feed of definition changes in the uberon

item.title: UBERON:0002776 ; ventral nuclear group
item.description:
OLD: The ventral nuclear group is a collection of nuclei on the ventral side of the thalamus. According to MeSH, it consists of the following: ventral anterior nucleus ventral lateral nucleus ventral posterior nucleus [WP,unvetted].
NEW: Nuclei in the ventral part of the thalamus, involved in modulating activity of dorsal thalamic nuclei.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0004645 ; urinary bladder urothelium
item.description:
OLD: An urothelium that is part of a urinary bladder.
NEW: The epithelial lining of the luminal space of the urinary bladder.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0012290 ; fused carpals 2 and 3
item.description:
OLD: A carpal bone that is formed from the fusion of the 2nd and 3rd carpal bones.
NEW: A carpal bone that is formed from the fusion of the 2nd and 3rd distal carpal bones.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0000117 ; respiratory tube
item.description:
OLD: A tube in the respiratory tract.
NEW: A tube in the respiratory system. Examples: bronchus, bronchiole, trachea.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0001993 ; reticular layer of dermis
item.description:
OLD: lower layer of the dermis, found under the papillary dermis, composed of dense irregular connective tissue featuring densely packed collagen fibers. It is the primary location of dermal elastic fibers.
NEW: The thicker, deeper layer of the dermis, comprised of criss-crossing collagen fibers that form a strong elastic network and also containing blood and lymph vessels, nerves and nerve endings, and hair follicles

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0006539 ; mammary gland fluid/secretion
item.description:
OLD: A portion of organism substance that secreted_by a mammary gland.
NEW: A fluid that is secreted by a mammary gland.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0000200 ; gyrus
item.description:
OLD: A ridge, generally surrounded by one or more sulci.
NEW: A ridge on the cerebral cortex. It is generally surrounded by one or more sulci .

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0002549 ; ventral trigeminal tract
item.description:
OLD: The ventral trigeminothalamic tract serves as pain, temperature, and light touch pathway from the face, head and neck. It receives input from trigeminal nerve, facial nerve, glossopharyngeal nerve and vagus nerve. It receives discriminative tactile and pressure input from the contralateral principal sensory nucleus of CN V, which terminates in the ventral posteromedial nucleus of the thalamus. It then ascends to the contralateral sensory cortex via three neurons . [WP,unvetted].
NEW: The Anterior trigeminothalamic tract (or ventral trigeminothalamic tract) serves as pain, temperature, and light touch pathway from the face, head and neck. It receives input from trigeminal nerve, facial nerve, glossopharyngeal nerve and vagus nerve. It receives discriminative tactile and pressure input from the contralateral principal sensory nucleus of CN V, which terminates in the ventral posteromedial nucleus of the thalamus. It then ascends to the contralateral sensory cortex via three neurons .

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0001140 ; renal vein
item.description:
OLD: The renal veins are veins that drain the kidney. They connect the kidney to the inferior vena cava. It is usually singular to each kidney, except in the condition 'multiple renal veins'. It also divides into 2 divisions upon entering the kidney: the anterior branch which receives blood from the anterior portion of the kidney and, the posterior branch which receives blood from the posterior portion. Often, each renal vein will have a branch that receives blood from the ureter. [WP,unvetted].
NEW: Either of the pair of major vessels which arise from the renal hilus and return blood from the kidneys, suprarenal gland and the ureter to the inferior vena cava.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0006497 ; interosseous muscle of pes
item.description:
(was pes interosseus muscle)

OLD: An interosseus muscle that is part of a pes.
NEW: An interosseous muscle that is part of a pes.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0002448 ; fungiform papilla
item.description:
OLD: The fungiform papillae are mushroom shaped e (projections) on the tongue. They are located on the top (dorsal) surface of the tongue, scattered throughout the filiform papilla but mainly at the tip and lateral margins of the tongue. They have taste buds on their superior (upper) surface which can distinguish the five tastes: sweet, sour, bitter, salty, and umami. They have a core of connective tissue. They are innervated by the seventh cranial nerve, more specifically via the submandibular ganglion, chorda tympani, and geniculate ganglion ascending to the solitary nucleus (the sensory component of the Vagus nerve in the brainstem). [WP,unvetted].
NEW: any of the mushroom-shaped papillae, which have a single taste bud at the tip, located mostly on the dorsal anterior portion of the tongue

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0008777 ; hypaxial musclulature
item.description:
OLD: trunk muscles that lie ventral to the horizontal septum of the vertebrae.
NEW: Musculature that is derived from the hypaxial myotome region, trunk muscles that lie ventral to the horizontal septum of the vertebrae. Hypaxial muscles include some vertebral muscles, the diaphragm, the abdominal muscles, and all limb muscles.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0011509 ; sphincter colli profundus muscle
item.description:
OLD: The sphincter colli profundus of lie below the platysma in the area of the parotid gland (gland regions).
NEW: The sphincter colli profundus lies below the platysma in the area of the parotid gland (gland regions).

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0004740 ; basibranchial bone
item.description:
(was basibranchial)

OLD: Median ventral cartilage or bony element at the ventral point of a branchial arch, behind the tongue.
NEW: A basibranchial element that is bone. Basibranchial elements are ventral, median, and associated with a single pharyngeal arch in the pharyngeal arch 3-7 skeleton

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0002989 ; anconeus muscle
item.description:
OLD: small muscle on the posterior aspect of the elbow joint.
NEW: A small muscle on the posterior aspect of the elbow joint.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0001401 ; longissimus thoracis muscle
item.description:
OLD: The longissimus is the muscle lateral to the semispinalis. It is the longest subdivision of the sacrospinalis that extends forward into the transverse processes of the posterior cervical vertebrae. [WP,unvetted].
NEW: The longissimus thoracis is the intermediate and largest of the continuations of the sacrospinalis.[WP]. intermediate erector spinae muscle of back; origin, with iliocostalis and from transverse processes of lower thoracic vertebrae; insertion, by lateral slips into most or all of the ribs between angles and tubercles and into tips of transverse processes of upper lumbar vertebrae, and by medial slips into accessory processes of upper lumbar and transverse processes of thoracic vertebrae; action, extends vertebral column; nerve supply, dorsal primary rami of thoracic and lumbar spinal nerves[Stedmans].

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0000052 ; fornix of brain
item.description:
OLD: The fornix (Latin, 'vault' or 'arch') is a C-shaped bundle of fibres in the brain, and carries signals from the hippocampus to the mammillary bodies and septal nuclei. [WP,unvetted].
NEW: A C-shaped bundle of fibres in the brain, and carries signals from the hippocampus to the hypothalamus. [WP,unvetted].

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0002521 ; elastic tissue
item.description:
OLD: Elastic fibers (or yellow fibers) are bundles of proteins found in extracellular matrix of connective tissue and produced by fibroblasts and smooth muscle cells in arteries. These fibers can stretch up to 1.5 times their length, and snap back to their original length when relaxed. Elastic fibers include elastin, elaunin and oxytalan. Elastic tissue is classified as 'connective tissue proper'. The elastic fiber is formed from the elastic microfibril and amorphous elastin. The microfibril scaffolds and organizes the deposition of amorphous elastin. Amorphous elastin forms from monomers of soluble tropoelastin which is insolubilized and crosslinked into amorphous elastin by lysyl oxidase. Lysyl oxidase reacts with specific lysine residues and by oxidative deamination generates reactive aldehydes and allysine. These reactive aldehydes and allysines can react with lysine and other allysine residues to crosslink and form desmosine, isodesmosine, and a number of other polyfunctional crosslinks that join surrounding elastin molecules to build an elastin matrix and elastic fiber. These unique crosslinks are responsible for elastin's elasticity. [WP,unvetted].
NEW: Connective tissue composed of elastic fibers.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0001502 ; interosseous muscle of manus
item.description:
OLD: An interosseus muscle that is part of a manus.
NEW: An interosseous muscle that is part of a manus.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0011827 ; areolar gland
item.description:
OLD: Lobular organ the parenchyma of which consists of acini connected to the surface of the areola or to a lactiferous duct by the duct of areolar gland. Examples: There are variable numbers of areolar glands.
NEW: A sebaceous glands in the areola surrounding the nipple.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0009568 ; trunk region of vertebral column
item.description:
OLD: Subdivision of vertebral column that corresponds to the trunk of the body, containing the trunk/presacral vertebrae.
NEW: Subdivision of vertebral column that corresponds to the trunk of the body, containing the trunk/presacral vertebrae. In organisms that have a thoracic and lumbar distinction, this corresponds to the sum of both of these regions.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0003615 ; lung elastic tissue
item.description:
OLD: An elastic tissue that is part of a lung [Automatically generated definition].
NEW: Elastic tissue that is part of a lung [Automatically generated definition].

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0002468 ; foliate papilla
item.description:
OLD: Taste-buds, the end-organs of the gustatory sense, are scattered over the mucous membrane of the mouth and tongue at irregular intervals. They occur especially in the sides of the vallate papillae. There is a localized area at the side of the base of the tongue, the foliate papillae, in which they are especially abundant. [WP,unvetted].
NEW: any of the papillae located on the sides of the tongue

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: UBERON:0000396 ; vallate papilla
item.description:
OLD: Any one of the largest papilla of the tongue, 8 to 12 in number, arranged in the form of a V anterior to the sulcus terminalis of the tongue
NEW: any of the large papillae, which have multiple taste buds in the trough surrounding the papillae, located near the base and on the dorsal side of the tongue

AmiGO | QuickGO
